name: Python Portscanner
tagline: A mass-target portscanner written in python
body:
Python Portscanner V0.1 === About --- My first Python Porject.
Current version is more than basic...
The script isn't finished yet and it isn't user-friendly at all, but I will improve this in the future. How to use --- 1.- Download all and extract it into an empty directory.
2.- Execute the main.py script with the python interpreter. Some information about the script --- * Current version scans all IPs from x.x.x.1 to x.x.x.255
* You can change the target in the ipscanner.py script on line 17
* A file with a list of the results is saved in the same directory than the scripts.
* Reports will be overwritten by executing the script twice, to prevent this, rename the resulting file for each scan.
* The script creates temporary files in /tmp/, wich means that it only works on OS X and Linux Systems (windows compatibility coming soon). The tmp-files should be deleted automaticly at the end of the script, if not, Unix will delete them at the next boot. Contact --- Message me via Jabber: 5tream@dukgo.com
Drop an eMail: admin@7base.net Changelog --- - V0.1 Initial upload
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
